Americans, not just Iowans, need to know that Joni Ernst is up to something, suggesting cutting medicare, medicaid, social security, & essentially attacking the most vulnerable Americans.

Pharmacy deserts are increasingly causing people to turn to mail order meds. Many medications are heavily impacted by temperature changes, which can put patients at risk. Under my plan, rural pharmacies will be paid for their service, not for their volume.
There should be no profit motive in producing life saving medications. Firefighters aren’t available to residents who pay the most, and neither should an Epi-Pen.

In 2019, Senator  took a busload of people across a river in Michigan into Canada. These riders purchased lifesaving insulin at a fraction of the cost. Senators should care less about super PAC money than the lives of their constituents.

Although public anger over increased prices often rests on manufacturers, a major component of increased drug prices is PBM’s. Instead of squealing to the bank with money from special interests like Joni Ernst, I will make sure drug costs are reigned in with medicare negotiation & opening international markets.

text: I’ve been with my husband for almost 28 years. For 27 of those years, we’ve been raising children. We didn’t set out to be parents. This wasn’t about fulfilling some desire. It was because someone asked us if we could help, and we said we would. Service workers often endure incredibly difficult working conditions. These workers should not be relying on tips from customers to put food on the table. I support federal minimum wage requirements that all tipped workers receive a minimum $15/hr.

On my first day in the senate, I will introduce legislation to create a task force in the DOL designed to audit wage theft, prohibit forced arbitration, & enact a federal punishment model similar to Minnesota’s. Robbery should be treated as robbery.
The  estimated the impact of wage theft nationally was nearly three times as high as robberies. Yet there is very little being done federally or at the state level to protect workers.

A 2017 study by the EPI estimates nearly $15 billion is stolen from workers nationally every year. But  seems more inclined to give corporate tax breaks than hold labor law violators accountable. - Alternatively - This exceeds the value of all property crimes committed in the United States each year.
The Economic Policy Institute estimates employers steal nearly $600 MILLION from Iowans every year.
Forced arbitration allowed employers to steal $12.6 billion from their low wage employees last year.

Even our most beloved tech startups can be sources of exploitation. Despite having to pay $20M over misleading car loan offers to their drivers, Uber is trying to get into the loan business again. This time, it is a short term, payday lending program.

The gig economy leaves workers particularly vulnerable to exploitation. In one of the more recent high profile cases, DoorDash was found to pay an average of $1.45 an hour - accounting for expenses. Even if it is done through an app, it is still feudalism.

text: 🚨🚨🚨BREAKING: The Senate just passed SJR 2001. While this is a devastating blow in the fight to protect our rights, there are still chances to stop this amendment.  This amendment must also pass the House through its version of the bill HSB 577. Deciding to step away from the classroom after 10 years was one of the hardest decisions I've had to do. A quality education can absolutely shape a young person's life.  It was great chatting with the awesome folks again at the Save the Children Action Network while we were at the Progress Iowa Corn Feed! SCAN works to ensure all American children have access to high-quality early education and helping kids survive by ending preventable, early childhood deaths around the world.

Iowa just saw its wettest 12-month period on record. The effects of the climate chaos across Iowa this year are apparent. We see delays in corn and soybean planting, lower crop yield estimates, and devastating floods. Iowa is in danger!

I've asked all Mauro campaign staff to affirmatively report to the Federal Bureau of Investigation, and other relevant law enforcement, any contact with foreign agents or governments offering information or attempts to influence elections in Iowa or throughout the United States.  This campaign WILL NOT tolerate such behavior that reflects poorly on our values. I’m seeking to hold myself and my staff to the highest standards possible.

Today I wrote a letter to FBI Director Christopher Wray in response to President Trump’s willingness to encourage and accept foreign influence on our country’s election process.   and Americans must recognize this as an invitation for corruption to U.S. elections and poses a security threat to our nation. The  recent remarks DOES NOT reflect Iowa and American values.   As your United States Senator, I will take responsibility for the integrity and security of our political processes and country.

America must support and lead the world’s rapid transition to zero emissions and beyond. We need to regain our key economic advantage that has been slipping away in recent years as elected officials repeatedly squander opportunities to lead.

Happy  to my  Iowans and beyond. I am proud to have played a part in the LGBTQ community for years and am so proud our state’s legacy of equality, the strides we’ve made as a nation to support the rights who choose to love who they love. Together, we can advance and preserve these rights but today we celebrate you.

In the Senate, I will fight for a comprehensive job guarantee program that would employ up to 20 million people. These will be jobs with strong incomes, plus benefits. I want to see every American have a chance to succeed.

I will make an effort to reverse ecological overshoot and stop the sixth mass extinction. There needs to be an effort to preserve adequate habitat for wildlife while slowing global population is necessary to prevent the continued disintegration of our life-support systems.

If we are going to restore a safe climate, we must draw down the excess carbon and other greenhouse gases that are already in the atmosphere. Iowa is in a unique position to lead the charge in the challenge of drawing down excess carbon.

The climate crisis poses a clear and present danger to humanity and the natural world, but it’s no longer a crisis we are in chaos. America is in danger, and the storms are getting stronger! Join the Mauro Team if you feel we deserve better.

Rural Iowans need to travel at least 15 miles to get to a hospital. And many rural hospitals are no longer providing OB and psychiatric services, so patients need to travel even farther to get care. We need to reverse this trend.

We have now been on the campaign trail as an official candidate for a week. Voters have discussed healthcare at every stop. Individuals continue to see rising costs for their premiums and deductibles with no relief in sight. And many are electing not to fill prescriptions, get needed medical care, or seeing specialists because they can’t afford it. Eddie Mauro will fight for affordable and accessible healthcare.

With my friend Earl Harper at a Memorial Day Prayer Service. 50 years ago today he was in Vietnam, 12 years ago today he was in Iraq. Today we remember all those who have sacrificed so much for the freedoms we enjoy. The price of freedom is not free. Because of its tremendous cost, we should ensure that the promise of this country made available by the sacrifice of so many men and women endures.

I have been an advocate for DMARC and the fight to meet the needs of the hungry and most vulnerable in our communities for decades. We need a leader willing to address poverty, food insecurity, homelessness, mental health, addiction, education, and a just economy. In a meaningful way. Without courageous and determined leadership we will not solve the real problems in this country.

Eddie worked as a teacher and coach. He understands the challenges that our educators face while working in schools that are underfunded and crumbling. Eddie also coached a Dowling Catholic baseball team to a state championship. Finding solutions to today's educational challenges will be a top priority for Eddie in the United States Senate.

I stopped at Congresswoman Cindy Axne’s DC office to deliver a letter from flood survivors in Southwest Iowa. Her chief of staff Joe Diver took the letter for us.

Father Patrick at St. Pamachius School in Moshi, Tanzania just sent me this picture today. Happy I was able to help him secure a reliable vehicle to get to and from school and for continued development of water projects in Tanzania. The smiles on their faces say it all.  Fact: 23 million people in Tanzania don't have access to clean drinking water.  The Purify Project is committed to helping those who are sick, poor and facing desperate situations due to unsafe drinking water. You can help us carry out our mission of improving health by providing clean water to children throughout Tanzania—one cup at a time.  LEARN MORE:

Welcome Home & Thank You!  On March 29, 1973 the last of the American prisoners of war held in North Vietnam came home.  Today we celebrate and honor all those brave heroes on this .  Today we remember the 58,000 men and women who are inscribed on the Vietnam Memorial in DC that gave their lives for the US and the World.  And today I vow to advocate for policies to aid  and all  who have bravely stood up for America to protect our freedoms and our values.

I'm very lucky to have access to health insurance, and access to regular preventive visits. That coverage and regular check-ups helped me deal with a lung that had collapsed. I'm doing fine and am heading home with a clean bill of health thanks to great doctors and nurses.  Now, if I were to lose coverage or let coverage lapse - I’d be one of millions of Americans living with a . Donald Trump and Joni Ernst want to ditch the Affordable Care Act and its protections for those with pre-existing conditions.  It's time to preserve the aspects of the  that are working, and work on fixing the areas that aren't.  We need to expand access to Healthcare for ALL Americans, reign in the big pharmaceutical companies, and expand access to Medicaid for more low-income folks - permanently.  Interesting that Trump is only now looking for a fix.  Where has he been the last two years??

Erin go brah! St. Patrick's Day is here. The day comes about because of a young boy who was kidnapped from Britain, taken to Ireland and enslaved. After escaping and joining a monastery, St. Patrick returned to Ireland as an immigrant, the place where he was enslaved. He brought a message of helping others and worked to change hearts and minds about loving your neighbor and caring for the less fortunate. Let's drink to that! Happy !
